official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a
		  credit against tax for hurricane and tornado mitigation
		  expenditures.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Hurricane and Tornado Mitigation
			 Investment Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Nonrefundable
			 personal credit for hurricane and tornado mitigation property

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting after
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
the
			 following new section:

text.#text:
In the case of an individual, there shall be allowed as a
				credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount
				equal to 25 percent of the qualified hurricane and tornado mitigation property
				expenditures made by the taxpayer during such taxable year.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for any taxable
				year shall not exceed $5,000.

text.#text: The credit allowed under

For purposes of this
				section—

header.#text:
Qualified
				hurricane and tornado mitigation expenditure

continuation-text.#text:
in a
				qualified dwelling unit located in a qualified State and owned by the
				taxpayer.

term.#text:
qualified hurricane and tornado mitigation
				property expenditure

text.#text: The term

to improve the
				strength of a roof deck attachment,

to create a
				secondary water barrier to prevent water intrusion,

to improve the
				durability of a roof covering,

to brace gable-end
				walls,

to reinforce the
				connection between a roof and supporting wall,

to protect
				openings from penetration by windborne debris, or

to protect
				exterior doors and garages,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is allowed.

term.#tail:
means a dwelling unit that is assessed at
				a value that is less than $1,000,000 by the locality in which such dwelling
				unit is located and with respect to the taxable year for which the credit
				described in

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means Alabama,
				Arkansas, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois,
				Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts,
				Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New
				York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South
				Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, or Virginia.

text.#text: The term

An
				expenditure shall be taken into account in determining the qualified hurricane
				and tornado mitigation property expenditures made by the taxpayer during the
				taxable year only if the onsite preparation, assembly, or original installation
				of the property with respect to which such expenditure is made has been
				completed in a manner that is deemed to be adequate by a State-certified
				inspector.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be taken into
				account in determining the qualified hurricane and tornado mitigation property
				expenditures made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

text.#text:
For purposes of this section, expenditures for labor costs
				properly allocable to the onsite preparation, assembly, or original
				installation of the property described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be taken into
				account in determining the qualified hurricane and tornado mitigation property
				expenditures made by the taxpayer during the taxable
				year.

text.#text:
For purposes of this section, expenditures for inspection
				costs properly allocable to the inspection of the preparation, assembly, or
				installation of the property described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by inserting after the item
			 relating to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subpart A of part IV of
			 subchapter A of chapter 1 of such Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: the following new item:

text.#text: The table of sections for

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 25E. Hurricane and tornado mitigation
				property.

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable
			 years beginning after December 31, 2012.

, the hurricane and tornado

				property expenditures made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.
